availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Anthony B. Hundley (Washington County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace)

body.p: Washington County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Son of Sherwood Hudley and Julia Hudley. Married to Susan S. Dorsey Hundley in Madison County, Illinois, on December 15, 1835. Father of John Sherwood Hundley, Nimrod D. Hundley, and Susan S. Hundley. Married to Julia Ann West Dorsey Hundley in Madison County, Illinois, on July 9, 1857. Father of Matilda Belle Hundley, Anthony B. Hundley, Julia C. Hundley, Katie Hundley, Mary Hundley, and Eckford Hundley. Stepfather of Nestly Dorsey, Adam Dosey, and Samuel Dorsey. Farmer in Washington County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned thirty enslaved persons in Washington County in 1850. Farmer in Washington County in 1860. Owned seventeen enslaved persons in Washington County in 1860. Justice of the peace in Washington County in 1862.
